CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1941, page 2, reads: "The 'Hap' Obrien Aviation School located at the Greensburg Airport has announced that it has trained and will continue to train Negro fliers and instructors using the latest available equipment. In co operation with the Federal Civil Aeronautics Authority and the Pittsburgh Association of Owners and Pilots, a general program has been approved leading to the private and commercial pilots licence and the licensed and the advanced instructors licence. Over 3,000 graduates have received licences from this school in the past 14 years and not one accident has occurred at the field! 'Hap' Obrien states that those interested may join present classes at any time and continue an organized program of study. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Five small airplanes parked outside a hangar at the Greensburg Airport
